between.description: The linearly-referenced sub-segment of the geometry, specified as a range (pair) of percentage displacements from the start of the geometry, that the containing AccessRestrictionRule applies to.
between.title: Between

ConnectorReference.description:
Contains the GERS ID and relative position between 0 and 1 of a connector feature
along the segment.

at.description: The linearly-referenced position on the geometry, specified as a percentage displacement from the start of the geometry, that the containing ConnectorReference applies to.
at.title: At

ConnectorReference.title: ConnectorReference

DestinationLabelType.description:
Indicates what special symbol/icon is present on a signpost, visible as road
marking or similar.
DestinationLabelType.title: DestinationLabelType

DestinationLabels.description: The type of object of the destination label.

value.description: Names the object that is reached
value.title: Value

DestinationLabels.title: DestinationLabels

final_heading.description: Direction of travel on the segment identified by 'to_segment_id' that leads to the destination.

from_connector_id.description: Identifies the point of physical connection on this segment before which the destination sign or marking is visible.
from_connector_id.title: From Connector Id

labels.description: Labeled destinations that can be reached by following the segment.
labels.title: Labels

symbols.description: A collection of symbols or icons present on the sign next to current destination label.
symbols.title: Symbols

to_connector_id.description: Identifies the point of physical connection on the segment identified by 'to_segment_id' to transition to for reaching the destination(s).
to_connector_id.title: To Connector Id

to_segment_id.description: Identifies the segment to transition to reach the destination(s) labeled on the sign or marking.
to_segment_id.title: To Segment Id

DestinationSignSymbol.description:
Indicates what special symbol/icon is present on a signpost, visible as road
marking or similar.
DestinationSignSymbol.title: DestinationSignSymbol

Heading.description: Travel direction along an oriented path: forward or backward.
Heading.title: Heading

LevelRule.description:
A single level rule defining the Z-order, i.e. stacking order, applicable within
a given scope on the road segment.

between.description: The linearly-referenced sub-segment of the geometry, specified as a range (pair) of percentage displacements from the start of the geometry, that the containing LevelRule applies to.
between.title: Between

value.description: Z-order of the feature where 0 is visual level
value.title: Value

LevelRule.title: LevelRule

NameRule.description: Name rule with variant and language specification.

between.description: The linearly-referenced sub-segment of the geometry, specified as a range (pair) of percentage displacements from the start of the geometry, that the containing NameRule applies to.
between.title: Between

perspectives.description: Political perspectives from which a named feature is viewed.

side.description: The side, either left or right, that the containing NameRule applies to.

NameRule.title: NameRule

rules.description: Rules for names that cannot be specified in the simple common names property. These rules can cover other name variants such as official, alternate, and short; and they can optionally include geometric scoping (linear referencing) and side-of-road scoping for complex cases.
rules.title: Rules

countries.description: Countries holding the given mode of perspective.
countries.title: Countries

mode.description: Whether the perspective holder accepts or disputes this name.

between.description: The linearly-referenced sub-segment of the geometry, specified as a range (pair) of percentage displacements from the start of the geometry, that the containing ProhibitedTransitionRule applies to.
between.title: Between

final_heading.description: Direction of travel that is prohibited on the destination segment of the sequence.

sequence.description: Ordered sequence of connector/segment pairs that it is prohibited to follow from this segment.
sequence.title: Sequence

PurposeOfUse.description:
Reason why a person or entity travelling on the transportation network is using a
particular location.
PurposeOfUse.title: PurposeOfUse

RailClass.description: Captures the kind of rail segment.
RailClass.title: RailClass

RailFlag.description:
Simple flags that can be on or off for a railway segment.

Specifies physical characteristics and can overlap.
RailFlag.title: RailFlag

RailFlagRule.description: Rail-specific flag rule with geometric scoping only.

between.description: The linearly-referenced sub-segment of the geometry, specified as a range (pair) of percentage displacements from the start of the geometry, that the containing RailFlagRule applies to.
between.title: Between

RailFlagRule.title: RailFlagRule

bbox.description: An optional bounding box for the feature
bbox.title: Bbox

id.description: A feature ID. This may be an ID associated with the Global Entity Reference System (GERS) if—and-only-if the feature represents an entity that is part of GERS.
id.title: Id

^ext_.*$.description:
Additional top-level properties are allowed if prefixed by `ext_`.

This feature is a on a deprecation path and will be removed once the schema is
fully migrated to Pydantic.

access_restrictions.description: Rules governing access to this road segment
access_restrictions.title: Access Restrictions

connectors.description: List of connectors which this segment is physically connected to and their relative location. Each connector is a possible routing decision point, meaning it defines a place along the segment in which there is possibility to transition to other segments which share the same connector.
connectors.title: Connectors

level_rules.description: Defines the Z-order, i.e. stacking order, of the road segment.
level_rules.title: Level Rules

rail_flags.description: Set of boolean attributes applicable to railways. May be specified either as a single flag array of flag values, or as an array of flag rules.
rail_flags.title: Rail Flags

sources.description: The array of source information for the properties of a given feature, with each entry being a source object which lists the property in JSON Pointer notation and the dataset approved sources from the Overture Data Working Group that contains the relevant metadata for that dataset including license source organization.
sources.title: Sources

subclass_rules.description: Set of subclasses scoped along segment
subclass_rules.title: Subclass Rules

RecognizedStatus.description:
Status of the person or entity travelling as recognized by authorities
controlling the particular location.
RecognizedStatus.title: RecognizedStatus

RoadClass.description: Captures the kind of road and its position in the road network hierarchy.
RoadClass.title: RoadClass

RoadFlag.description:
Simple flags that can be on or off for a road segment.

Specifies physical characteristics and can overlap.
RoadFlag.title: RoadFlag

RoadFlagRule.description: Road-specific flag rule with geometric scoping only.

between.description: The linearly-referenced sub-segment of the geometry, specified as a range (pair) of percentage displacements from the start of the geometry, that the containing RoadFlagRule applies to.
between.title: Between

RoadFlagRule.title: RoadFlagRule

bbox.description: An optional bounding box for the feature
bbox.title: Bbox

id.description: A feature ID. This may be an ID associated with the Global Entity Reference System (GERS) if—and-only-if the feature represents an entity that is part of GERS.
id.title: Id

^ext_.*$.description:
Additional top-level properties are allowed if prefixed by `ext_`.

This feature is a on a deprecation path and will be removed once the schema is
fully migrated to Pydantic.

access_restrictions.description: Rules governing access to this road segment
access_restrictions.title: Access Restrictions

connectors.description: List of connectors which this segment is physically connected to and their relative location. Each connector is a possible routing decision point, meaning it defines a place along the segment in which there is possibility to transition to other segments which share the same connector.
connectors.title: Connectors

destinations.description: Describes objects that can be reached by following a transportation segment in the same way those objects are described on signposts or ground writing that a traveller following the segment would observe in the real world. This allows navigation systems to refer to signs and observable writing that a traveller actually sees.
destinations.title: Destinations

level_rules.description: Defines the Z-order, i.e. stacking order, of the road segment.
level_rules.title: Level Rules

prohibited_transitions.description: Rules preventing transitions from this segment to another segment.
prohibited_transitions.title: Prohibited Transitions

road_flags.description: Set of boolean attributes applicable to roads. May be specified either as a single flag array of flag values, or as an array of flag rules.
road_flags.title: Road Flags

road_surface.description: Physical surface of the road. May either be specified as a single global value for the segment, or as an array of surface rules.
road_surface.title: Road Surface

sources.description: The array of source information for the properties of a given feature, with each entry being a source object which lists the property in JSON Pointer notation and the dataset approved sources from the Overture Data Working Group that contains the relevant metadata for that dataset including license source organization.
sources.title: Sources

speed_limits.description: Rules governing speed on this road segment
speed_limits.title: Speed Limits

subclass_rules.description: Set of subclasses scoped along segment
subclass_rules.title: Subclass Rules

width_rules.description:
Edge-to-edge width of the road modeled by this segment, in meters.

        Examples: (1) If this segment models a carriageway without sidewalk, this value represents the edge-to-edge width of the carriageway, inclusive of any shoulder. (2) If this segment models a sidewalk by itself, this value represents the edge-to-edge width of the sidewalk. (3) If this segment models a combined sidewalk and carriageway, this value represents the edge-to-edge width inclusive of sidewalk.
width_rules.title: Width Rules

RouteReference.description: Route reference with linear referencing support.

between.description: The linearly-referenced sub-segment of the geometry, specified as a range (pair) of percentage displacements from the start of the geometry, that the containing RouteReference applies to.
between.title: Between

network.description: Name of the highway system this route belongs to
network.title: Network

ref.description: Code or number used to reference the route
ref.title: Ref

symbol.description: URL or description of route signage
symbol.title: Symbol

RouteReference.title: RouteReference

SequenceEntry.description: A segment/connector pair in a prohibited transition sequence.

connector_id.description: Identifies the point of physical connection between the previous segment in the sequence and the segment in this sequence entry.
connector_id.title: Connector Id

segment_id.description: Identifies the segment that the previous segment in the sequence is physically connected to via the sequence entry's connector.
segment_id.title: Segment Id

SequenceEntry.title: SequenceEntry

Side.description:
The side, left or right, on which something appears relative to a facing or heading direction
(*e.g.*, the side of a road relative to the road orientation), or relative to the direction of
travel of a person or vehicle.
Side.title: Side

SourcePropertyItem.description:
An object storing the source for a specified property.

The property is a reference to the property element within this Feature, and will be
referenced using JSON Pointer Notation RFC 6901 (
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/rfc6901/).
The source dataset for that referenced property will be specified in the overture list of approved sources from the Overture Data Working Group that contains the relevant metadata for that dataset including license source organization.

between.description: Linear reference range [start, end] where 0.0 <= start < end <= 1.0
between.title: Between

license.description: License name. This should be a valid SPDX license identifier when available. If the license is NULL, contact the data provider for more license information.
license.title: License

record_id.description: Refers to the specific record within the dataset that was used.
record_id.title: Record Id

update_time.description: Timestamp when the feature was last updated
update_time.title: Update Time

SourcePropertyItem.title: SourcePropertyItem

Speed.description:
A speed value, i.e. a certain number of distance units travelled per unit
time.
Speed.title: Speed

between.description: The linearly-referenced sub-segment of the geometry, specified as a range (pair) of percentage displacements from the start of the geometry, that the containing SpeedLimitRule applies to.
between.title: Between

Subclass.description: Refines expected usage of the segment, must not overlap.
Subclass.title: Subclass

SubclassRule.description: Set of subclasses scoped along segment.

between.description: The linearly-referenced sub-segment of the geometry, specified as a range (pair) of percentage displacements from the start of the geometry, that the containing SubclassRule applies to.
between.title: Between

SubclassRule.title: SubclassRule

between.description: The linearly-referenced sub-segment of the geometry, specified as a range (pair) of percentage displacements from the start of the geometry, that the containing SurfaceRule applies to.
between.title: Between

TravelMode.description:
Enumerates possible travel modes.

Some modes represent groups of modes.
TravelMode.title: TravelMode

VehicleAxleCountSelector.description: Selects vehicles based on the number of axles they have.

value.description: Number of axles on the vehicle
value.title: Value

VehicleAxleCountSelector.title: VehicleAxleCountSelector

VehicleHeightSelector.description: Selects vehicles based on their height.

unit.description: Height unit in which `value` is expressed

value.decription: Vehicle height selection threshold in the given `unit`
value.title: Value

VehicleHeightSelector.title: VehicleHeightSelector

VehicleLengthSelector.description: Selects vehicles based on their length.

unit.description: Length unit in which `value` is expressed

value.description: Vehicle length selection threshold in the given `unit`
value.title: Value

VehicleLengthSelector.title: VehicleLengthSelector

VehicleRelation.description: Relational operator, such as less than or equal to.
VehicleRelation.title: VehicleRelation

VehicleWeightSelector.description: Selects vehicles based on their weight.

unit.description: Weight unit in which `value` is expressed

value.description: Vehicle weight selection threshold in the given `unit`
value.title: Value

VehicleWeightSelector.title: VehicleWeightSelector

VehicleWidthSelector.description: Selects vehicles based on their width.

unit.description: Width unit in which `value` is expressed

value.description: Vehicle width selection threshold in the given `unit`
value.title: Value

VehicleWidthSelector.title: VehicleWidthSelector

bbox.description: An optional bounding box for the feature
bbox.title: Bbox

id.description: A feature ID. This may be an ID associated with the Global Entity Reference System (GERS) if—and-only-if the feature represents an entity that is part of GERS.
id.title: Id

during.description: The recurring time span, in the OpenStreetMap opening hours format, that the containing AccessRestrictionRule applies to. For the OSM opening hours specification, see https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:opening_hours/specification.
during.title: During

heading.description: The heading, either forward or backward, that the containing AccessRestrictionRule applies to.

mode.description: A list of one or more travel modes, such as car, truck, or foot, that the containing AccessRestrictionRule applies to.
mode.title: Mode

recognized.description: A list of one or more recognized status values, such as employee or student, that the containing AccessRestrictionRule applies to.
recognized.title: Recognized

using.description: A list of one or more usage purposes, such as delivery or arrival at final destination, that the containing AccessRestrictionRule applies to.
using.title: Using

vehicle.description: A list of one or more vehicle parameters that limit the vehicles the containing AccessRestrictionRule applies to.

items.description: Selects vehicles that a scope applies to based on criteria such as height, weight, or axle count.

vehicle.title: Vehicle
